FOUND IN: Combustion - The process in which a substance reacts with oxygen to give off heat and light
Couplet (poetic term for a pair of verses, but can also be used figuratively to describe two people together as 'a couple')
Noh - Classical Japanese theater that combines music, dance, and drama to convey spiritual themes.
Might - Having great physical power or strength.
Masterpiece - an outstanding work of art, literature, etc., considered the original and highest achievement in its field (noun)
Training - the process of teaching and developing skills, knowledge, or performance in specific areas.
Scarlet-tinted - A deeper red, often evoking the intensity of strong feelings like shame or embarrassment.
Stress accent - An emphasis on a particular syllable or word within speech that may vary with different accents.
